summary: The 2007 Cadillac DTS has heated/air-conditioned front seats. They went out. Looking on the Cadillac users' website it seems to be a common problem. The connectors burn out, even though they are connected to a 30 amp fuse. Having an electrical system short out under the passenger seat can be life threatening. Request a recall on the faulty connection box under the passenger seat. The heated rear seat is fine.

WHEN I CALL ON STAR FOR A DIAGNOSTIC  TEST THAT WHEN I WAS TOLD THAT IF WAS IN AN ACCIDENT THE CAR AIR BAGS WOULD NOT PROTECT ME LIKE THEY WERE SUPPOSE TO.I WAS DRIVING TO THE NEXT TOWN OVER FROM MY HOMETOWN ON HWY 8O EAST.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE STALLED INTERMITTENTLY WITH SEVERAL WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATED BUT, RESUMED NORMAL WITHIN SECONDS. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHO DIAGNOSED THE VEHICLE HOWEVER, WAS UNABLE TO DUPLICATE THE ISSUE. THE MECHANIC INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT ECM MAY BE DEFECTIVE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND CONFIRMED THERE NO RECALL ON THE VIN. NO DEALER WAS CONTACTED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 119,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE WAS EVIDENCE OF AN OIL LEAK UNDERNEATH THE VEHICLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE WAS AN ABNORMAL OIL BURNING ODOR COMING FROM THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT WHILE DRIVING. THE OIL LEVEL WARNING LIGHT WAS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO CLASSIC BUICK GMC ARLINGTON AT (400 E INTERSTATE 20, ARLINGTON, TX 76018) WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE OIL PAN AND MASTER KIT GASKET NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 55,000.

ENGINE FAILURE DO TO POOR DESIGN AND OIL LEAKS. I HAD THIS HAPPEN ON THE HIGHWAY WITCH IS VERY DANGEROUS. THE WHOLE ENGINE NEEDS RECALLED. THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM IS A NIGHT ONE MY FUSE BOX'S NEEDED REPLACED BECAUSE A FUSE BURNED OUT, WITCH MELTED A GOOD PORTION OF IT. MAJOR FIRE HAZARD!!!!

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 30 MPH, THE CONTACT ACTIVATED THE RIGHT TURN SIGNAL. THE INDICATOR BULB BURNED OUT AND BURNED THE HOUSING OF THE HEADLIGHT. THE CONTACT STATED NO WARNING LIGHT WAS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO INDEPENDENT MECHANIC TO BE DIAGNOSED. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE HEADLIGHT HOUSING ASSEMBLY NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE LOCAL DEALER WAS NOT CONTACTED. THE MANUFACTURER HAD NOT BEEN INFORMED OF FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 39,700.*DT*JB

I'M GETTING AN SERVICE AIR BAG MESSAGE ON MY DASHBOARD DISPLAY AT ALL TIMES AFTER STARTING THE VEHICLE AT A STAND STILL AND IN MOTION I'M AFRAID THAT MY AIRBAGS ARE GOING TO BLOW AT ANYTIME I'M AFRAID OF DRIVING THE VEHICLE.

WHEN I BOUGHT THE CAR THE OWNER TOLD ME THE POWER STEERING WAS BAD AND THAT THEY WOULD FIX IT. THEY REPLACED THE POWER STEERING PUMP BUT IT DIDN'T FIX THE ISSUE. WHEN I TOOK THE CAR TO GET INSPECTED SO I COULD GET IT TITLED, IT FAILED THE INSPECTION DUE TO A LEAK IN THE POWER STEERING HIGH PRESSURE LINE, THE REAR THIRD BRAKE LIGHT BEING BROKE, THE TOP MOTOR MOUNT FAILING AND BOTH THE FRONT AND BACK WHEEL BEARINGS BEING WORN. WHEN I TOOK THE CAR BACK TO THE DEALERSHIP, THE OWNER GOT IN MY FACE AND SHOVED ME MAKING ME LEAVE.

HELLO!I RECENTLY PURCHASED A 2007 CADILLAC DTS WITH 71,000 MILES GOOD FOR THIS YEAR.WHEN PURCHASING THIS VEHICLE WHEN DRIVING WATER FELL ON MY LEGS.I TOLD DEALER ABOUT THIS AND THE DEALER SENT IT TO A CADILLAC DEALER TO FIX THE LEAK.SO I PURCHASED THE 2007 CADILLAC DTS.ABOUT 3 WEEKS LATER IT RAINED AND DRIVER AND PASSENGER REAR WAS SOAKED AND THE STABILIZER CONTROL ON DASH ICON SAYING SERVICE STABILIZER.I TOOK IT BACK TO DEALER AND FOUND OUT TAILLIGHTS WERENT WORKING PROPERLY.WILL ANYWAY SO MANY TRIPS TO DEALERS AND MOONROOF IS STILL LEAKING AND DUE TO FLOORS GETTING SOAKED THE YAW UNDER DRIVERS SEAT HAS BEEN DAMAGED BY THE WATER AND CAUSED THE STABILIZER TO SHORTEN OUT SO IT WILL INTERFER WITH STABILITY ON WET AND SNOW CONDITIONS WITH NO CONTROL.I HAVE SINCE REPLACED THE YAW BUT FLOOR IS STILL GETTING WET FROM RAIN .I BELEIVE THIS IS A SAFETY HAZARD FOR SURE.IT SHOULD BE PRESENTED TO CADILLAC AS A SERIOUS DEFECT.THIS PROBLEM STARTED 10/14/2018

TO:NHTSA GOOD MORNING! EMAILING TO FORM A COMPLAINT OF WHEELS FACTORY CADILLAC CHROME THAT ARE RUSTY AND CHIPPING OF OF WHEELS ON THE INSIDE,THE OUTSIDE IS SHINY.I THINK THERE IS A POSSIBILITY IN TIME THEY COULD CAUSE A PROBLEM.I REALIZE MY CAR IS A 2007 CADILLAC IS A 2007 BUT WHEN I WAS LOOKING TO PURCHASE A USED CADILLAC THEY ALL SEEMED TO HAVE THIS RUST PROBLEM...

WHEN IT RAINS WATER JUST POURS DOWNS US FROM THE SUN ROOF TOP CAUSING THE FLOORS  OR CARPET TO SMELL FROM THE WATER ... PLEASE HELP WITH DIRECTION WITH THIS PROBLEM .. THUS ACCUSED WHILE WE WERE DRIVING  IN THE RAIN ...

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE REAR WINDOW BRAKE LIGHT HAD FRACTURED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC FOR REPAIRS, BUT THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND ADVISED THE CONTACT TO CALL NHTSA. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 69,193.

FACTORY CHROME WHEELS ARE RUSTY ON INSIDE OF WHEEL AND CHROME COATING IS OFF ON ALL 4 WHEELS,COULD BE SAFETY ISSUE IF THEY RUST THROUGH METAL.THESE ARE FACTORY WHEELS AND I NOTICED WHEN I PURCHASED VEHICLE IN SEPTEMBER OF 2018.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 45 MPH, THE POWER STEERING MALFUNCTIONED AND THE STEERING WHEEL BECAME VERY DIFFICULT TO TURN IN EITHER DIRECTION. THE VEHICLE WAS DRIVEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHO DIAGNOSED THAT THE POWER STEERING FLUID LEVEL WAS LOW. POWER STEERING FLUID WAS ADDED TO THE VEHICLE, BUT THE FAILURE CONTINUED. THE MANUFACTURER AND THE LOCAL DEALER (R.J. BURNE CADILLAC, 1205 WYOMING AVE, SCRANTON, PA) WERE NOTIFIED, BUT NO ASSISTANCE WAS OFFERED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 82,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT AN INDEPENDENT REPAIR FACILITY HAD BEEN INFORMED MORE THAN ONCE THAT THE OIL PRESSURE WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED SEVERAL TIMES. THE DEALER HAD NOT BEEN CONTACTED. WHILE DRIVING AT AN UNSPECIFIED RATE OF SPEED, THE OIL PRESSURE WARNING INDICATOR FLASHED, THERE WAS A SUDDEN LOSS OF POWER, AND THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS STIFF WHEN DEPRESSED. AS A RESULT, THE CONTACT CRASHED INTO THE REAR OF AN 18 WHEELER. THE DRIVER SUSTAINED MINOR BRUISING AND PAIN TO THE SHOULDERS AND FOREARMS. MEDICAL ATTENTION WAS RECEIVED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE DRIVER'S SIDE AIR BAG DEPLOYED, BUT WAS UNCERTAIN IF THE FRONT PASSENGER AND SIDE CURTAIN AIR BAGS ALSO DEPLOYED. A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A TOW LOT. THE INSURANCE COMPANY WAS NOTIFIED OF THE CRASH AND HAD NOT YET INVESTIGATED THE CAUSE OF THE CRASH. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE CRASH AND THE CONTACT WAS AWAITING TO DETERMINE IF THEY COULD CONDUCT AN INVESTIGATION. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 119,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED, THE GEAR WAS SHIFTED INTO DRIVE AND THE TRACTION CONTROL AND SERVICE BRAKE WARNING INDICATORS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING OR REPAIRS. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 122,000.
ALL THE DTS FROM 2007 TO 2012, HAVE A FAULTY 3RD BRAKE LIGHT ON THE TRUNK. THE LIGHT WORKS WHEN IT WANT TO AND THEY STOP LIGHTING WHEN IT WANTS TO.IT IS A FACTORY DEFECT.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS, THE CONTACT NOTICED OIL ON THE GROUND. WHILE DRIVING, THE CONTACT NOTICED SMOKE COMING FROM THE HOOD OF THE VEHICLE AND OIL LEAKING FROM THE MANIFOLD. THERE WERE NO WARNING INDICATORS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO JOHNSON MOTOR COMPANY OF GEORGIA CADILLAC AT (1122 WALTON WAY, AUGUSTA, GA 30901, (706) 955-1086) WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE OIL PAN GASKET AND THE SEAL NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 116,000. THE VIN WAS UNAVAILABLE.

WHILE TURNING INTO A PARKING SPACE AT A VERY LOW SPEED MY ENGINE BY ITSELF ACCELERATED VERY FAST AND I IMMEDIATELY PUT MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE BUT THIS DID NOT STOP THE CAR SO I PUT IT INTO REVERSE AND KEPT MY FOOT ON BRAKE THE CAR CONTINUE TO ACCELERATE VERY FAST BUT EVENTUALLY STOPPED. MY CAR WAS TOTALLED AS IT  HIT THE CAR IN FRONT OF ME WHICH HIT THE CAR ON IT SIDE WHEN I WAS GOING FORWARD, WHEN IT WAS IN REVERSE I  DID NOT HIT ANY CARS. LUCKILY NO ONE WAS IN THE CARS I HIT AND I DID NOT GET HURT. THERE WAS A WITNESS WHO SAW MY BRAKE LIGHTS ON WHEN MY CAR WAS OUT OF CONTROL ACCELERATING.

THERE WAS A RECALL ON THIS IGITION SWITCH BEFORE. THE IGITION SWITCH IS NOT LOCKING AND SO IS THE STEERING WHEEL. MY VEHICLE WAS STATIONARY WHEN I DISCOVER THIS. I'M AFRAID THIS MAY CAUSE OTHERS ISSUES.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING, THE HEADLIGHTS FAILED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER BUT WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND INFORMED THAT THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN ANY RECALLS. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 78,276.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE CHECK BATTERY/RECHARGE SYSTEM INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THERE WAS ALSO A BURNING ODOR AND SPARKS PRESENT. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHO DIAGNOSED THAT THE ALTERNATOR NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN A RECALL. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 160,000.

THE FRONT HEATED/COOLED SEATS WERE WORKING INTERMITTENTLY, WHILE DRIVING, SINCE JANUARY 2017. TWO WEEKS AGO THEY STOPPED ALTOGETHER. UPON INVESTIGATION I HAD TO REMOVE THE PASSENGER SEAT IN ORDER TO INSPECT THE CONTROL MODULE. I FOUND TWO WIRES BURNED AND THE LARGE PLUG STUCK IN THE CONTROL MODULE PIN AREA.  I'M WAITING ON SOME PARTS BEFORE I CAN PROCEED WITH THE POSSIBLE REPAIR. THERE SHOULD BE AN IMMEDIATE RECALL TO HAVE GM REPAIR THIS PROBLEM AT NO COST TO THE CONSUMER. IT IS DEFINITELY A FIRE HAZARD.  THE NUMBER ON THE CONTROL MODULE IS 100-1325-F. THERE MAY BE ANOTHER SPECIFIC NUMBER BUT I HAVE BEEN UNABLE TO FIND ON THE INTERNET.

NOT A COMPLAINT BUT A CLARIFICATION REGARDING COMPLAINT NUMBER 10946916. I HAD OVER HEATING ON MY BRAKES DOWN A LONG DOWNHILL RUN. IN DRIVE (D) THE CADILLAC FREEWHEELS AND DOES NOT ENGINE BRAKE, REQUIRING CONSTANT USE OF BRAKES. THE LOCAL CADILLAC DEALER SAID I COULD NOT ENGINE BRAKE IN MY DTS. THAT RESULTED IN THE OVERHEATING THE FRONT BRAKE DISKS. BUT AFTER CONTACTING CADILLAC CORPORATE THEY INFORMED ME I COULD USE D3 AND D2 TO ENGINE BRAKE. THAT WOULD HAVE PREVENTED THE OVERHEATING OF MY FRONT BRAKE DISKS. THE FRONT DISKS SHOULD STILL HAVE ABSORBED THE HEAT WITHOUT OVERHEATING BUT AT LEAST NOW I CAN GO DOWN THAT STRETCH WITHOUT CONCERN.

WE HAVE AN APPROXIMATELY 14 MILES DOWNHILL RUN FROM THE SKI SLOPE TO I-95. THE DTS DOES NOT COMPRESSION BRAKE. CRUISE CONTROL WILL NOT HOLD A DOWNHILL SPEED. SO I AM ON THE BRAKES MOST OF THE WAY DOWN. HALFWAY DOWN THE HILL THE FRONT END STARTS TO SHAKE VIOLENTLY I AM GUESSING THE FRONT BRAKES ARE WARPED FROM THE CONSTANT USE. I MAKE IT DOWN THE HILL AND DRIVE ONTO I-95S. AFTER 30 OR SO MILES THE BRAKES COOL AND NO MORE VIBRATION. THIS IS NOT THE FIRST TIME. I ASKED THE CADILLAC DEALER HOW TO PUT IT INTO COMPRESSION BRAKING AND THEY SAID I CANNOT DO THAT. THERE HAS TO BE A FIX OR A RECALL ON THAT. IT IS A CADILLAC WHICH RETAILS FOR 65K PLUS WHEN NEW. THE FRONT DISK BRAKES SHOULD NOT OVERHEAT AND START TO WARP. NORMAL SPEED WAS THE SPEED LIMIT BUT WITHOUT COMPRESSION BRAKING THE CADILLAC DTS ACCELERATES RAPIDLY AND CONSTANT BRAKE USE IS NEEDED TO KEEP IT TO THE POSTED SPEED LIMIT. I ONLY HAVE 38K ON THE 2007 CADILLAC DTS. IT IS THE HIGH PERFORMANCE FULL UP LUXURY MODEL.

EXCESSIVE ENGINE OIL LEAKS AND USAGE.PARKED AND DRIVING.I HAVE BEEN INFORMED BY SEVERAL MECHANICS THAT THIS IS A VERY TYPICAL PROBLEM WITH THE NORTHSTAR ENGINE BUT I DONT BELIEVE IT SHOULD BE SO.THE ESTIMATED COST TO ATTEMPT A FIX RUNS UP INTO THE $1000S OF DOLLARS .I THINK THAT GENERAL MOTORS SHOULD BE AT MINIMUM PARTIALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS DEFECT!

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. WHILE DRIVING AT VARIOUS SPEEDS, A STRONG ODOR OF SMOKE WAS PRESENT IN THE VEHICLE. THERE WERE NO WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT OIL WAS LEAKING FROM THE ENGINE GASKETS AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 190,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. WHILE DRIVING 25 MPH, THE VEHICLE STARTED TO SHAKE AND THE LIGHTS FLICKERED. THE CONTACT STARTED TO SMELL A FUEL ODOR AND NOTICED SMOKE UNDER THE HOOD. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE INJECTOR 8 CONTROL CIRCUIT SPILLED OIL INTO THE INJECTOR AND NEEDED TO BE REPAIRED. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 92,109.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WAS SMOKE AROUND THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC. THE TECHNICIAN DIAGNOSED THAT OIL WAS LEAKING ONTO THE MANIFOLD PRODUCING THE ABNORMAL ODOR. IN ADDITION, THE TECHNICIAN STATED THAT THE ENGINE NEEDED TO BE RESEALED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 60,000.   UPDATED 02/12/16*LJ  THE CONSUMER STATED THE CRANK CASE LEAKED OIL ONTO THE MANIFOLD

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 55 MPH, THE CONTACT SMELLED OIL BURNING INSIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THERE WAS OIL LEAKING FROM THE ENGINE GASKETS AND THE GASKETS NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED BUT THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 55,000.  ...UPDATED 01/20/16 *BF  *JS

THE ISSUE WAS REGARDING THE FAILURE OF THE BALLASTS IN THE HID HEADLIGHTS WHICH, PER NTSB AND OTHER WEBSITES, HAS BEEN A SIGNIFICANT ISSUE WITH THIS AND OTHER GM MODELS. THE ISSUE SEEMS TO BE DIAGNOSED GENERALLY AS WATER BACKING DOWN THE HEADLIGHT ASSEMBLY INTO THE BALLAST CAUSING THE FAILURE. THERE IS ALSO A TSB ON THE ISSUE: HTTP://WWW.CADILLACFORUMS.COM/FORUMS/CADILLAC-DTS-FORUM-2006-THROUGH-2012/173283-TSB-FLICKERING-HEADLIGHTS.HTML AND PAGES OF THE NTSB FILINGS ABOUT THE HEADLAMPS ARE HERE HTTP://WWW.CARCOMPLAINTS.COM/CADILLAC/DTS/2006/LIGHTS/EXTERIOR_LIGHTING-3.SHTML    AFTER BEING STOPPED TWICE BY LAW ENFORCEMENT FOR A HEADLAMP OUT, WE TOOK THE CAR TO RON CARTER CADILLAC IN HOUSTON, TEXAS WHERE WE WERE CHARGED ABOUT $850 TO REPLACE THE RIGHT FRONT BALLAST. THE LEFT ONE WAS ALSO JUST STARTING TO SHOW THE SAME PROBLEM SO I MADE THE CONTACT TO GM AND WAS WORKING WITH KIM. MY WIFE WAS JUST STOPPED THE OTHER DAY BY A POLICE OFFICER REGARDING THE LEFT LAMP.     KIM WAS GOING TO CONTACT RON CARTER CADILLAC AND HAVE THEM CONTACT ME REGARDING THE LEFT LAMP AND WORK OUT A DEAL ON IS REPLACEMENT. I ASSUME KIM DID HER JOB BUT RON CARTER HAS NEVER TO THIS DAY CALLED US REGARDING THE LEFT LAMP. THEY ALSO HAD NO INTEREST IN WORKING WITH GM ON THE ORIGINAL RIGHT HEADLIGHT ISSUE SAYING IT WAS 'THE CUSTOMER'S PROBLEM TO WORK WITH GM'.

AFTER RESEARCHING MY HEATER/COOLER PROBLEM IN MY SEATS I FIND THE CADILLAC NEEDS TO BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROBLEM THAT HAS EXISTS FOR A LONG TIME AND EVEN AFTER CONSULTING AUTHORIZED CADILLAC DEALESHIPS I HAVE BEEN GIVEN THE RUN AROUND BECAUSE THEY COULD NOT FIND THE PROBLEM! I JUST WANT CADILLAC TO FIX MY CURRENT HEAT/COOLER PROBLEM IN MY SEATS!

WHILE SITTING AT A COMPLETE STOP ENGINE VERY RAPIDLY BECAME HOT TURNING ON ENGINE OVERHEAT INDICATOR.  THERE AS BEEN OIL APPEARING IN MY DRIVEWAY THE LAST 3 DAYS. AFTER RESEARCH I FOUND THERE IS A VERY WELL KNOWN ISSUE WITH THIS MODEL FOR A CRANKSHAFT LEAK. AFRAID THIS COULD LEAD TO ENGINE FAILURE OR FIRE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE HAD A SUDDEN LOSS OF POWER AND A DRASTIC REDUCTION IN SPEED WHILE TRAVELING ON A MAJOR HIGHWAY. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER WHO STATED THAT THE HOSE WAS LOOSELY CONNECTED PERTAINING TO THE TRANSMISSION FAILURE. THE DEALER WAS FURTHER DIAGNOSING THE VEHICLE TO DETERMINE WHAT PARTS NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND PROVIDED NO REMEDY. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

I WAS TURNING INTO THE SHOPPING CENTER WHEN MY DRIVERS SIDE SUSPENSION BROKE. I WENT CAREENING THOUGH THE PARKING LOT HITTING A PARKED CAR BEFORE FINALLY STOPPING WHEN I COLLIDED WITH A PILLAR AT THE MALL.I BUMPED MY NOSE ON THE STEERING WHEEL BUT THE AIR BAGS DID NOT IMPLODE BUT MY CAR IS TOTALED.   *TR

2007 CADILLAC DTS SERVICE DEPARTMENT REFUSED TO FIX VEHICLE *CN  THE CONSUMER STATED THERE WAS AN ISSUE WITH THE TRANSMISSION GEARS, WHICH CAUSED A NOISE.  THE DEALER WAS UNABLE TO FIND A PROBLEM. *JB
HEATED SEAT CONNECTOR MELTED.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT RECEIVED A NOTIFICATION FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 14V355000 (ELECTRICAL SYSTEM). HOWEVER, THE PART NEEDED TO DO THE REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. IN ADDITION, WHEN SHIFTING INTO REVERSE, THE VEHICLE MOVED FORWARD. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE CONTACT'S RESIDENCE AND, AFTER PARKING, ALL THE EXTERIOR LIGHTS ILLUMINATED INDEPENDENTLY. THE CONTACT WAS UNABLE TO INSERT THE KEY IN THE IGNITION SWITCH TO TURN THE LIGHTS OFF. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE DEALER. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNAVAILABLE.
THE HEATED AND COOLED FRONT SEATS HAVE STOPPED WORKING. MAY POSSIBLY BE A FIRE HAZARD. SHOULD RIGHTFULLY BE RECALLED. *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE STEERING WHEEL WAS EXTREMELY DIFFICULT TO TURN. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER, WHO DIAGNOSED THAT THE POWER STEERING HOSE NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 37,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT RECEIVED A NOTIFICATION FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 14V355000 (ELECTRICAL SYSTEM). HOWEVER, THE PART NEEDED TO DO THE REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT INDICATED THAT WHILE WAITING AT A TRAFFIC LIGHT, ANOTHER VEHICLE CRASHED INTO THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE, WHICH CAUSED THE CONTACT TO HIT THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HER AND THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY. THE CONTACT INDICATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS THE THIRD OUT OF THE SIX VEHICLES INVOLVED IN THE CRASH. A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED. THE DRIVER SUSTAINED INJURIES TO THE LEFT ARM WHICH REQUIRED MEDICAL ATTENTION. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED AND WAS TO BE FURTHER INSPECTED BY THE INSURANCE ADJUSTOR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 62,000.   UPDATED 12/9/14*CN

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 14V355000 (ELECTRICAL SYSTEM). THE CONTACT WAS WAITING FOR THE RECALL REPAIR FOR THREE WEEKS DUE TO THE RECALL PART NOT BEING AVAILABLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT DID NOT EXPERIENCE A FAILURE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 14V355000 (ELECTRICAL SYSTEM) AND STATED THAT THE PART WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE DEALER DID NOT GIVE A SPECIFIC DATE FOR WHEN THE PART WOULD BECOME AVAILABLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS ALSO CONTACTED AND COULD NOT PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED DATE FOR WHEN THE CONTACTS VEHICLE WOULD RECEIVE THE RECALL REPAIR. THE CONTACT DID NOT EXPERIENCE A FAILURE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE STOPPED, THE TEMPERATURE GAUGE INCREASED. THE TEMPERATURE GAUGE RETURNED TO NORMAL ONCE THE VEHICLE WAS SHUT OFF AND RESTARTED. IN ADDITION, THE VEHICLE STALLED WITHOUT WARNING. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER. THE DEALER DIAGNOSED THAT WATER PUMP WAS LEAKING. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE DEALER ALSO DISCOVERED THAT THE HEAD GASKET WAS BLOWN DUE TO WATER AND ANTI-FREEZE MIXING. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 117,000.

SINCE THIS FIRST INDECENT I FIND EVER TIME IT RAINS IF I GO THRU A PUDDLE OF WATER AND TURN LEFT OR RIGHT THAT THE POWER STEERING WILL GO OUT FOR SEVERAL SECONDS BEFORE YOU CAN RECOVER. TODAY WE HAVE HEAVY RAIN AND AT ONE TURN IT NEARLY RESULTED WITH ME HITTING A SEMI TRUCK THAT WAS IN A MERGE LANE AND AS I MADE MY TURN ONTO THE HIGHWAY STEERING AGAIN OUT, I COULD NOT COMPLETE THE TURN WHICH POINTED ME AT THE FAR LANE AND THE ONCOMING MAMMOTH TRUCK AS I JERKED THE WHEEL THE STEERING REGAINED AND I JOLTED BACK INTO MY LANE. WHEN WILL CADILLAC BE REQUESTED TO ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM OR ARE THE LARGE NUMBER OF PEOPLE WITH THIS PROBLEM GOING TO HAVE TO HAVE FACE THE FEAR OF A SERIOUS ACCIDENT BEFORE WE RESOLVE THIS ISSUE. CASE AFTER CASE THE DEALERS DO NOT KNOW WHAT THE CAUSE IS AS STATED IN COMPLAINTS.  *TR

THE PLUG THAT CONNECTS TO THE HEAT/COOL MODULE HAS NOW MELTED ON THE YELLOW/RED WIRE WHICH IS ABOUT A 10GA WIRE.  I HAVE READ MANY FORUMS AND ONLINE ARTICLES ABOUT GM HAVING THIS PROBLEM ON MANY OTHER GM VEHICLES.  THIS IS A HUGE PROBLEM WHICH CAN RESULT IN A FIRE SINCE THE WIRE GETS HOT IT CAN POSSIBLY IGNITE THE PADDING UNDERNEATH THE SEAT.  I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO FIX THIS MYSELF IT SHOULD BE REPAIRED BY THE DEALER.  I CURRENTLY HAVE ABOUT 47K MILES ON MY CADILLAC AND THE HEAT AND COOL SEATS NO LONGER WORK UNLESS I MAKE THE REPAIRS.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT RECEIVED A NOTIFICATION FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 14V355000 (ELECTRICAL) AND STATED THAT THE PART NEEDED FOR THE RECALL REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE.   UPDATED 10/07/14*LJ

YOU ALREADY SHOW RECALL INFORMATION ON 2007 CADILLAC DTS FOR IGNITION KEY SAFETY PROBLEM BUT I WOULD LIKE TO COMPLAIN THAT GM TELLS ME IN THEIR RECALL LETTERS THAT THE PARTS TO FIX THIS ARE NOT AVAILABLE.  ON CALLING THEM AND POSING THE QUESTION WHETHER GM IS BACK-LOGGED HAVING TO MAKE SO MANY PARTS TO FIX THE ISSUE OR IF IT IS THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE A 'FIX' YET, GM SAID THEIR ENGINEERS ARE WORKING ON IT AND HAVE NOT DETERMINED A FIX YET, THEREFORE NOT KNOWN WHAT PARTS THEY WILL NEED.  IT PUTS OWNERS IN A POSITION WHERE THEY MUST PLAY RUSSIAN ROULETTE.  SINCE BOTH MY 2007 DTS AND MY 2001 DEVILLE ARE ON LATEST RECALL LIST I DON'T HAVE A SAFE CAR TO DRIVE UNTIL GM REPAIRS THESE OR ELSE I MUST PURCHASE ANOTHER VEHICLE (NOT GM)  TO HAVE SOMETHING SAFE TO DRIVE.  I HAVE DETACHED EACH CAR'S IGNITION KEY FROM KEY RINGS SO THAT NOT EVEN THE FOB IS ATTACHED.  HOWEVER, APPEARS THAT THIS MERELY SERVES TO DIMINISH THE POTENTIAL THAT IN AN ACCIDENT THE KEY MIGHT NOT BE AS LIKELY TO SLIP FROM 'RUN' POSITION TO TURNING THE CAR OFF COMPLETELY, LEAVING ME WITH NO POWER STEERING, POWER BRAKES AND POSSIBILITY AIRBAGS WON'T DEPLOY.  GM HAS INSTRUCTED ITS DEALERSHIPS THAT THEY MAY NOT SELL ANY VEHICLE IN THIS RECALL UNTIL IT IS REPAIRED, SO THE CARS ARE, IN ESSENCE, WORTHLESS UNTIL THAT HAPPENS AND CAN NOT EVEN BE USED FOR TRADE-IN PURPOSES.  I SUSPECT THEIR COMPETITOR AUTO MANUFACTURERS ARE FULLY AWARE OF THE SITUATION AND WOULD NOT RELISH ANY GM TRADE-INS THAT, DUE TO LIABILITY POTENTIAL, THEY COULD NOT SELL ON TO ANYONE.  *TR

2007 CADILLAC DTS WITH APPROXIMATELY 67,000 MILES.  WHEN DRIVING AND AT ANY SPEED FROM 55 TO 70MPH A VIBRATION IS FELT VIA THE SEAT AND STEERING WHEEL.  THE VIBRATION IS ALSO BAD ENOUGH THAT IS VIBRATES THE PASSENGER SEAT BACK LOUDLY.  TIRES HAVE BEEN REPLACED, BRAKES CHECKED, WHEELS BALANCED X2, ETC.  ON LINE BLOGS INDICATE CADILLAC IS AWARE OF THE PROBLEM, BUT UNABLE TO DETERMINE PROBLEM.  *TR

THIS CAR IS A 2007 AND WE BOUGHT THIS CAR IN 2007 AND GOT A RECALL ON WINDSHIELD WASHER MODULE, WE TAKE IT AND THEY REPLACE A WIRE. NEXT WE GET A RECALL WANTING TO DISABLE AND REMOVE HEATED WINDSHIELD WASHER MODULE. THE RECALL READS LIKE THIS,  RECALL INFORMATION RECALL IMPORTANT, OUR PRIORITY IS YOUR COMPLETE SATISFACTION.   IT IS NOT OUR COMPLETE SATISFACTION TO TAKE THIS CAR IN AND DISMANTLE IT, AND SO FOR WE HAVEN'T DONE SO AND HAVE NO INTENTION OF DOING SO.  THE PROBLEM WITH THIS CAR SHOULD HAVE BEEN FIXED BY GENERAL MOTORS AND IT HASN'T BEEN. NOT VERY HAPPY ABOUT THIS.  *TR

THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 44,800 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 45,000. CONNECTOR UNDER FRONT PASSENGER SEAT MELTED DUE TO SOME SORT OF HIGH CURRENT PROBLEM.  FROM WHAT I READ ON THE CADILLAC FORUM, THIS IS AN OBVIOUS DESIGN FLAW.  SEE HTTP://WWW.CADILLACFORUMS.COM/FORUMS/CADILLAC-DTS-FORUM-2006-THROUGH-2012/285451-HEATED-SEATS-PARKING-SENSORS-STOPPED-WORKING.HTML#POST3288711    I AM CONCERNED THAT THIS MAY CAUSE A FIRE AS THE MODULE IS LOCATED DIRECTLY UNDER THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT CUSHION.  CONNECTOR PART 15326110 WAS REPLACED.  THIS MELTED CONNECTOR PROBLEM CAUSES (1) HEATED SEATS TO STOP OPERATING, (2) FRONT & REAR PARKING ASSIST TO STOP OPERATING, AND (3) AC THERMOSTAT TO OPERATE UNPREDICTABLY, E.G., HEATER WILL WARM CAR UP TO SET TEMPERATURE, E.G., 72 DEGREES, THEN THE AC WILL KICK ON TO COOL THE CAR...NOT DESIRABLE ON A COLD WINTER DAY.  *TR

ON 3/11/2014 YOUR OFFICE RESPONDED TO MY INQUIRY ON 3/11/2014 CONCERNING THE ABOVE VEHICLE. IN YOUR RESPONSE YOU STATED I WOULD HAVE ACCESS TO A REPORT WITHIN 72 HOURS @  HTTPS://WWW-ODI.NHTSA.DOT.GOV/VEHICLECOMPLAINT/. UPON ACCESSING THIS SITE THERE IS NO WHERE TO INPUT THE ODI NUMBER THAT YOU STATED WOULD GIVE ME ACCESS TO THE STATUS OF THE COMPLAINT. PLEASE ADVISE AS I INTEND TO PURSUE THIS ISSUE FURTHER UNTIL THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN REPAIRED OR REPLACED. THANK YOU.  *TR

ENGINE STOPPED. ALL POWER EQUIPMENT CEASED TO FUNCTION. I WAS ABLE TO GET TO THE SIDE OF THE FREEWAY. PUT THE CAR IN NEUTRAL, TURNED THE KEY AND THE CAR STARTED AND CONTINUED FOR THE DURATION OF THE 200 MILE TRIP. THE SECOND TIME APPROXIMATELY THREE WEEKS AGO MY WIFE WAS DRIVING IN HEAVY CITY TRAFFIC WHEN THE SAME PROBLEM OCCURRED AND SHE LOST THE USE OF ALL POWER EQUIPMENT. SHE WAS ABLE TO PUT THE CAR IN PARK AND GET IT STARTED AGAIN WITHOUT INCIDENT. I CALLED GM COMPLAINT DEPARTMENT. THEY INSTRUCTED ME TO TAKE THE CAR TO A DEALERSHIP AND HAVE A DIAGNOSTIC TEST DONE ON IT. THIS WAS DONE AND NOTHING WAS FOUND TO BE WRONG WITH THE VEHICLE. I AGAIN CALLED CADILLAC COMPLAINT DEPARTMENT AND OPENED A CASE. THIS TIME I WAS TOLD TO TAKE THE CAR BACK TO THE DEALERSHIP AND ASK THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT TO RECHECK IT. I INFORMED THEM I HAVE THE DIAGNOSTIC REPORT SHOWING NOTHING WRONG WAS FOUND. THEY SUGGESTED I TAKE IT BACK AND HAVE THE SERVICE PEOPLE DRIVE THE CAR. THIS DIDN'T MAKE ANY SENSE BECAUSE I DON'T KNOW WHEN AND WHERE THE PROBLEM WILL OCCUR AGAIN. WHAT WAS I TO DO FOR A CAR WHILE THE DEALERSHIP HAD MINE? I INQUIRED OF THE CADILLAC REPRESENTATIVE IF THIS CAR MAY HAVE THE SAME IGNITION AS THE CARS CURRENTLY BEING RECALLED BY GM. THEY WERE UNABLE TO ANSWER THAT QUESTION. THEY FINALLY STATED THE ONLY REMEDY WAS TO TAKE IT BACK TO THE DEALERSHIP. IF THIS PROBLEM OCCURS AGAIN SOMEONE COULD EASILY GET INJURED OR KILLED. I WOULD APPRECIATE ANY ASSISTANCE YOU CAN GIVE ME ON HOW TO RESOLVE THIS MATTER.

WHILE DRIVING ON THE INTERSTATE AT NIGHT AT 70 MPH, BOTH HEADLIGHTS FLICKERED THEN TURNED OFF. THE LIGHTS CAME BACK ON AFTER CYCLING TO AUTOMATIC LIGHT CONTROL SWITCH OFF THEN BACK ON. A FEW MINUTES LATER, THEY TURN OFF AGAIN. THIS DANGEROUS SITUATION HAS REPEATED NUMEROUS TIMES TONIGHT.   *TR

THE HEATED/COOLED SEATS STOPPED WORKING.  LATER THEY STARTED WORKING AGAIN.  THIS CYCLE OF WORKING/NOT WORKING CONTINUED FOR A FEW MONTHS THEN THEY QUIT COMPLETELY.  AFTER SEARCHING ONLINE FOR SOLUTIONS, I FOUND THAT THE DTS, BUICK LUCERNE, AND A FEW OTHER GM VEHICLES HAVE THIS SAME PROBLEM.  THE WIRING CONNECTOR UNDER THE PASSENGER SEAT OVERHEATS AND MELTS CAUSING A POOR CONNECTION RESULTING IN THE HEAT/COOL SETTINGS TO MALFUNCTION AND NOT WORK.  THIS IS A FIRE HAZARD!  GM IS CHARGING PEOPLE AROUND $1000 TO DIAGNOSE AND REPAIR THE PROBLEM WHEN IT'S THEIR OWN FAULTY ENGINEERING.  THERE SHOULD BE A SAFETY RECALL ON ALL THE VEHICLES WITH THIS PARTICULAR TYPE OF CLIMATE CONTROLLED HEATED/COOLED SEATS AND SHOULD BE NO CHARGE FOR THE REPAIR. IF I COULD SEND PICTURES I WOULD LET YOU SEE THE MELTED AND BURNED WIRING CONNECTOR IN MY CAR.   *TR

I WAS BLOWN AWAY TO FIND OIL UNDER MY 07 DTS CADILLAC, THEN TO LEARN IT'S COMMON. THINKING IT WAS A DRAIN PLUG OR OIL FILTER CHANGED THE OIL. NO SUCH LUCK, IT'S THE ENGINE LOWER END LEAKING. THINKING IT WASN'T SO BAD TO NOT DRIVE I WATCHED THE OIL LEVEL CLOSELY. I NOTICED OIL FILM COVERING THE RIGHT REAR QUARTER PANEL AND REAR TRUNK LID AND A DRIPPY COATING OF OIL UNDER THE CAR. THIS MAKES IT A DANGER TO THE HIGHWAYS AND OTHER CARS BY LEAKING A QUART EVERY HUNDRED MILES. FOR DRIVERS NOT WATCHING OIL LEVELS THIS WILL TURN INTO A BROKEN DOWN CAR AT BEST, AN OIL FIRE VERY POSSIBLE ON THE ROAD THESE ARE NEVER SAFE.    THIS HAS BEEN A COMMON PROBLEM WITH THE CADILLAC NORTHSTAR ENGINE FOR YEARS, I SAY IT'S TIME TO DO A RECALL FOR THIS PROBLEM BEFORE PEOPLE GET INJURED OR KILLED. A LITTLE PRO-ACTIVE RECALL IS IN ORDER.  *TR

DAYTIME RUNNING LAMP (DRL) / TURN SIGNAL BULB APPEARS TO HAVE MELTED THE HEADLIGHT HOUSING.  BULB FAILURE CAUSED OWNER TO DISCOVER PROBLEM.  MELTED HOUSING WILL NO LONGER ACCEPT BULB FIXTURE.  THIS SEEMS FLAWED AND RESULTS IN A SAFETY ISSUE WHERE TURN SIGNAL ON FRONT OF CAR IS INOPERABLE WITHOUT EXPENSIVE REPLACEMENT OF ENTIRE HEADLIGHT HOUSING.  NEW HOUSING MAY NOT SOLVE HEATING PROBLEM THAT CAUSES MELTING.  THIS PROBLEM, AND SIMILAR CONSEQUENCES OF EXCESS LAMP HEAT, IS REPORTED BY OTHER OWNERS ON THE CADILLAC FORUM.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 4 MPH SHE APPLIED THE BRAKES WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL ABNORMALLY TRAVELED TO THE FLOORBOARD. THE VEHICLE DID NOT RESPOND AND EVENTUALLY COASTED TO A STOP INDEPENDENTLY. THE CONTACT INSPECTED THE BRAKE RESERVOIR AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO BRAKE FLUID. THE CONTACT ADDED BRAKE FLUID AND RESTARTED THE VEHICLE. THE FAILURE RECURRED SEVERAL MINUTES AFTER THE CONTACT RESUMED DRIVING. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR DIAGNOSIS AND THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE TWO FRONT BRAKE LINES AND THE ONE BRAKE LINE IN THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE EXHIBITED SEVERE CORROSION. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 54,500.

MY BATTERY CONSTANTLY GOES DEAD, EVERYTIME IT RAINS, SNOWS OR EVEN GETS COLD. I BROUGHT A BRAND NEW BATTERY AND A BRAND NEW ALTERNATOR AND IT STILL DOES THE SAME THING. THE AIR-BAG MESSAGE KEEPS COMING UP ALONG WITH EVERY ELECTRICAL COMPONENT THERE IS ON THIS CAR. I HAVE TAKEN IT TO DEALERSHIPS TO GET DIAGNOSTICS AND THEY NEVER FIND ANYTHING WRONG. THIS IS NOT SAFE FOR MY KIDS TO RIDE IN PLEASE ADVISE.  *TR

THE DEALER REPLACED THE BRAKES AND THE ROTORS, BUT THE FAILURE CONTINUED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT CONTACTED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 20,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 106,000. TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 15 MPH, THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE HEADLIGHT STOPPED ILLUMINATING. THE CONTACT STOPPED THE VEHICLE AND SHUT IT OFF. UPON RESTART, THE HEADLIGHT BEGAN ILLUMINATING AS NORMAL. THE FAILURE RECURRED OFTEN. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER FOR DIAGNOSIS. THE DEALER STATED THAT THE ENTIRE HEADLIGHT ASSEMBLY NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE HAD NOT BEEN REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED AND THEY STATED THAT THEY WOULD ONLY PAY FOR HALF OF THE REPAIR COSTS. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 27,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 29,560.

WE HAVE A  SEVERE  VIBRATION IN OUR 2007 CADILLAC DTS THAT STARTS AT 55MPH AND ALSO REPEATS ITSELF AS WE COME TO A STOP. THINK THIS VIBRATION IS ALWAYS THERE, BUT WE FEEL IT AT THESE TIMES. THIS VIBRATION WAS SO SEVERE THAT ON ONE OCCASION WE WERE COMING DOWN A MOUNTAIN SIDE IN VIRGINIA WHEN IT BECAME SO VIOLENT WE BARELY WERE ABLE TO BRING THE CAR UNDER CONTROL AND BRING IT TO A STOP. THIS IS A SYSTEMIC PROBLEM WITH DTS     GENERAL MOTORS ADVISED US THAT THEIR ENGINEERS ARE VERY AWARE OF THIS PROBLEM WITH DTS AND ARE WORKING ON THE PROBLEM, BUT HAVE NOT FIGURED OUT HOW TO REPAIR.. WE HAVE DONE EVERYTHING THEY HAVE ASKED .. REALIGNMENT, NEW PADS, NEW ROTARS, FOUR NEW TIRES ..THEY ARE QUITE FRANK THAT THE PROBLEM EXISTS, HAVE SEVERAL COMPLAINTS, NO ANSWERS, AND  THERE WILL BE NO RECALL AS THEIR PLAN IS TO SOLVE THE PROBLEM BY ATTRITION. THEY HAVE STOPPED MAKING THIS MODEL AS A RESULT. HOPE NO ONE HAS A SERIOUS ACCIDENT BEFORE THIS HAPPENS.  OUR RIDE AND SAFETY ARE BOTH NOW COMPROMISED ON A DAILY BASIS.

MY LENS COVERING IS DISCOLORING AND HAS BECOME CLOUDED OVER.  THIS WAS BROUGHT TO THE DEALERS ATTENTION UNDER WARRANTY.  HE SAID THIS IS NOT COVERED.  HOW CAN THIS BE WHEN NOW THE HEADLIGHTS ARE SIGNIFICANTLY LESS EFFECTIVE THROUGH THIS CLOUDY LENS. OTHER CADILLAC OWNERS IN THE DEALER HEAR MY CONVERSATION AND THEY HAD THE SAME PROBLEM.  THEY HAD  THE LENS REPLACED AT A COST OF OVER $350. A BLIND EYE SEEMS TO BE A TRUE SAFETY ISSUE THAT SHOULD BE A RECALL ITEM.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH HE ATTEMPTED TO ACCELERATE FURTHER, BUT THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT RESPOND TO THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER AND THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT DOWNSHIFT WHEN THE ENGINE RPMS REACHED 1500. THE CONTACT WAS ALSO INFORMED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS ENGINEERED TO OPERATE IN THAT MANNER. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND THE CONTACT WAS AWAITING A RESPONSE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 15,300.   THE CONSUMER STATED HE CAME TO A PASSING LANE ABOUT 1/4 MILE LONG AND PULLED OUT TO PASS. THE SHIFTER LEVER WAS IN "3" ON THE STEEP HILL. HE DEPRESSED THE ACCELERATOR TO ADVANCE INTO 2ND GEAR, BUT THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT DOWN SHIFT OR ACCELERATE. HE PULLED THE SHIFTER LEVER INTO 2ND . BUT THE TRANSMISSION STILL DID NOT DOWN SHIFT OR ACCELERATE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER. AFTER AN EXAMINATION, THE CONSUMER WAS INFORMED THE TRANSMISSION WAS DESIGNED TO NOT SHIFT DOWN ABOVE 1500 RPM. IN CONTRAST, THE OWNER'S MANUAL WARNED NOT TO DOWN SHIFT INTO 2ND ABOVE 65 MPH BECAUSE IT MAY DAMAGE THE TRANSMISSION.  UPDATED 11/17/11

NOT GOING TO ARGUE WITH THEM ANY MORE.... SOMETHING MUST BE DONE TO HELP US. THE RENTAL DTS I HAD WHILE MY CAR WAS IN "REPAIR" DID NOT HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM YET THEY SAID MY CAR TWILIGHT WAS "OK". THANKS

THE LEFT HEADLAMP ASSEMBLY HAD TO BE REPLACED DUE TO CORROSION.  APPROXIMATELY A MONTH LATER THE RIGHT HEADLAMP HAD TO BE REPLACED FOR THE SAME REASON. I HAVE SUBSEQUENTLY HAVE LEARNED THAT CADILLAC PUT OUT A BULLETIN, DOCUMENT ID #08014A, THAT ADDRESSES THE PROBLEM WITH CORROSION IN THE HEADLIGHTS. IF THE HEADLIGHTS FAILED OUT AT NIGHT, IN THE RAIN, CLEARLY IT IS  A SAFETY ISSUE.

9-02-2010 DRIVING 70 MILES PER HOUR ON I-75 N,  1.  CRUISE SUDDENLY CUTS OFF.  2.  CAR SLOWS TO 4-5 MILES PER HOUR.  3. SPEED ODOMETER CUTS OFF 4.  ALL SAFETY LIGHTS COME ON  5.  NO BRAKES 6. ANTI LOCK BRAKE LIGHT IS ON.  VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.  SINCE THEN CAR HAS BEEN TO DEALER FOR THE SAME TYPE OF THING SIX TIMES.  AFTER FIRST INCIDENT DEALER KEPT CAR APPROXIMATELY THREE WEEKS.  THEY COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE INCIDENT.  LOCAL DEALER VERY HELPFUL BUT CANNOT FIX.  FILED COMPLAINT WITH CADILLAC, CASE NUMBER [XXX], NO HELP.     INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).*TR

2007 CADILLAC DTS WITH LEVELING REAR STRUTS HAVE A SERIOUS ISSUE IN WIRING TO THE REAR SUSPENSION.  THOSE OPERATING IN HEAVY ROAD SALT ENVIRONMENT ARE EXPERIENCING WIRING FAILURES IN QUICK DISCONNECT TERMINALS. WHERE WIRES ARE INSERTED INTO CONNECTOR PINS SCOP UP SALT AGAINST UNPROTECTED COPPER WIRE .  THIS RESULTS IN COMPLETE DISCONNECTION DUE TO CHRONIC CORROSION.  THUS THE COMPUTER DISPLAYS A TROUBLE MESSAGE IN THE MAIN INSTRUMENT CLUSTER "SERVICE SUSPENSION."  THIS WIRING DISCONNECT/OPEN DISABLES THE AIR RIDE FEATURE IN THE REAR STRUTS.  THE WIRING INVOLVED RESIDES UNDER THE FLOOR PAN AND IS UNPROTECTED FROM THE ELEMENTS. THESE WIRE FAILURES CAN RESULT IN STEERING/HANDLING DIFFICULTIES DUE TO REAR SEAT AND TRUNK HEAVY LOADS.   FIX WOULD BE TO REQUIRE POTTING COMPOUND IN ALL GALLYS WHERE WIRES ENTER MALE PINS AND FEMALE RECEIVER CONNECTIONS.  POTTING COMPOUND WOULD CREATE A WATERPROOF EXCLUSION TO KEEP OUT THE DAMAGING ELEMENTS.  MY VEHICLE WAS SUPPOSED TO BE A GM CERTIFIED PRE-OWNED CAR THAT ORIGINATED IN THE BOSTON MASS AREA. *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS EQUIPPED WITH CONTINENTAL TOURING CONTACT AC TIRES. THE CONTACT STATED WHILE ACCELERATING FROM A STOP, THERE WAS A REPEATED THUMPING NOISE COMING FROM THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE TIRE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER WHERE THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE TREAD WAS WARPED AND THERE WAS A LUMP IN THE TIRE. THE TIRE WAS NOT REPLACED AND THE FAILURE CONTINUED TO RECUR. THE DOT NUMBER WAS NOT AVAILABLE.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 30,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 31,000.
AFTER PROLONGED AND CONTINUOUS BRAKING, CAR WILL PULSATE OR SHAKE AS IF THE BRAKE DISCS ARE BECOMING WARPED.  IS OBVIOUSLY CONNECTED TO HEAT BUILDUP, AS NORMAL BRAKING IS NOT AFFECTED. *TR

REF.ODI NUMBER 10289768 UNEXPLAINED ACCELERATION. UPON FURTHER STUDY I BELIEVE THE PROBLEM ORIGINATED IN THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM IN THE ENGINE CONTROL MODULE ( ECM). HAS A SOLUTION TO THIS PROBLEM BEEN PRESENTED? *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS. WHILE  DRIVING  APPROXIMATELY 45 MPH, A VEHICLE FAILED TO YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY, ENTERED INTO TRAFFIC,  AND THEN  CRASHED INTO THE LEFT SIDE OF HER VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE SPUN AROUND SEVERAL TIMES. THE VEHICLE STOPPED WHEN IT CRASHED INTO A WALL. THE DRIVERS FRONTAL AND SIDE AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY,  AND THE ON-STAR SYSTEM DID NOT ACTIVATE. THE VEHICLE WAS COMPLETELY DESTROYED. THE MANUFACTURER STATED THERE WAS NO REASON FOR THE AIR BAGS TO DEPLOY, AND THAT THE AIR BAGS WILL ONLY DEPLOY IF THE SENSOR WAS IMPACTED. THEY ADDED THAT THE ON-STAR SYSTEM ACTIVATES ONLY WHEN THE AIR BAGS DEPLOY. SHE RECEIVED INJURIES TO THE LEFT SIDE OF THE BODY AND A DISLOCATED DISC.  THE CURRENT AND  FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 50,000. THE POLICE INFORMATION WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

WHEN AT IDLE SPEED THE ENGINE SUDDENLY ACCELERATE TO A HIGH SPEED. I WAS SURPRISED AND PLACED THE CAR IN REVERSE. I SHOT BACKWARDS, WHERE AS I SHIFTED TO DRIVE. I HIT A SOLID OBJECT AND THE CAR WAS HEAVILY DAMAGED. I COULD NOT HOLD THE CAR WITH THE BRAKES. I TOTALLY PANICKED. *TR

BOUGHT CAR 2/7/2007.     AT 4000 MILES ,HAD VIBRATION, ROTORS WERE RUSTY AND OUT OF ROUND, REFINISHED ROTORS, THEN;A WEEK LATER ,VIBRATED WHEN APPLY BRAKES,LUG NUTS LOOSE,TIRES OUT OF BAL.- DEALER HAD LUG NUTS TIGHTENED AND ,FORCE BAL.TIRES.  AT  5513 MILES STILL A VIBRATION;- DEALER PUT ON NEW TIRES,   6 MONTHS LATER MADE A NOISE, FELT LOOSE IN FRONT , TOOK TO DEALER THEY REMOVED AND REPLACED R.AXLE  BRAKES VIBRATING AGAIN 5 MONTHS LATER.  CALLED COMPANY TOOK CAR TO ANOTHER DEALER; TURNED ROTORS & ROTATED TIRES,STILL  A VIBRATION,REPLACED FRONT ROTORS,  3MONTHS LATER HAD F.ROTORS REFINISHED & REMACHINED R. ROTORS   LESS THAN 500 MILES,VIBRATION AGAIN  SO BAD NOW STEERING WHEEL AND FRONT OF CAR SHAKES. I AM AFRAID TO  DRIVE THE CAR ,BRAKES MAY GIVE AWAY,COULD INJURE SOMEONE OR A PART MAY COME OFF CAR. IT DOESN'T FEEL SAFE TO DRIVE. I HAVE  READ OTHER REPORTS ON INTERNET LOTS OF PEOPLE HAVING VIBRATION PROBLEMS, MAY NEED A RECALL. WAITING NOW TO GET IN TO GET IT  FIXED AGAIN. *TR

IN TRAFFIC..TRUCK IN FRONT OF ME, APPLIED BRAKES AND DID NOT HAVE ANY.,.STEPPED ON   GAS AND HAD NO RESPONSE..SWERVED TO AVOID CRASH..DRIFTED INTO A PARKING LOT  AND CAR CAME TO A STOP AFTER SEVERAL MINUTES STARTED CAR AND SLOWLY DROVE HOME. TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE HINGES ON THE FRONT END OF HIS VEHICLE ARE INADEQUATE FOR THE TWO FRONT DOORS.  THE DOORS CLOSE AUTOMATICALLY AND THE WIND CAN BLOW THEM SHUT.  HE STATED THAT THE DOORS HAVE CLOSED ON HIM MANY TIMES.  HIS SON WAS INJURED WHEN THE DOOR SLAMMED ON HIS RIGHT FOOT WHILE EXITING THE VEHICLE.  THE CONTACT'S SON DID NOT GO TO THE HOSPITAL, BUT IS STILL EXPERIENCING A LOT OF PAIN AND MAY HAVE TO UNDERGO X-RAYS.  THE SERVICE MANAGER STATED THAT NOTHING COULD BE DONE ABOUT THE DOORS.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 6,200 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 200.  UPDATED 07/07/08.  *LJ  UPDATED

2007 CADILLAC DTS STOPPED IN MIDTRAFFIC.  AFTER A FEW MINUTES WAS ABLE TO RESTART, BUT IT WOULD ONLY GO 2 - 3 MPH.  LET IT SIT FOR AWHILE, THEN IT RESTARTED.  DROVE TO DEALER, FOUND NOTHING WRONG, HOWEVER, THEY RESET SOMETHING IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEM. THEY WERE NOT FORTHCOMING WITH INFORMATION! SECOND TIME THIS HAS HAPPENED! I AM FEARFUL THAT THIS WILL HAPPEN ON INTERSTATE 495 OR ANOTHER MAJOR HIGHWAY!  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNED A 2007 CADILLAC DTS.  WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH, THE CONTACT FELL ASLEEP AT THE WHEEL AND DROVE INTO A 3 FOOT DITCH, AND CRASHED INTO A CEMENT CULVERT.  THE VEHICLE FLIPPED OVER A FEW TIMES AND WAS DESTROYED.  THE FRONT END, REAR END, AND ROOF OF THE VEHICLE WERE HEAVILY DAMAGED.  THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY.  THE DRIVER AND PASSENGER WERE WEARING THEIR SEAT BELTS.  NEITHER WERE EJECTED FROM THE VEHICLE; HOWEVER, THE DRIVER SUSTAINED A BROKEN NECK AND SHOULDER DAMAGE.  THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE HAS NOT YET BEEN DETERMINED.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 4,000.   UPDATED 06/17/08 *BF

LIKE MANY OTHER CADDY OWNERS ARE HAVING PROBLEMS WITH  THE TWILIGHT SENSORS OPERATION.  PROBLEM BEING THE HEADLAMPS COME ON TOO EARLY AND GO OFF TOO LATE RESULTING IN A DIMMING OF THE INTERIOR DASH ILLUMINATION.  THIS CAUSES THE DRIVER NOT TO BE ABLE TO DETERMINE VEHICLE SPEED...ESPECIALLY IF ITS STILL BRIGHT ENOUGH OUT FOR SUN GLASSES TO BE USED.  MY 2007 DTS AND OTHERS.  SEE THIS LINK ALSO HTTP://WWW.CADILLACFORUMS.COM/FORUMS/CADILLAC-FORUM/T-92975.HTML  I HAD MY CAR TO THE GARAGE JUST TODAY AND THEY DID NOTHING TO FIX THIS SAFETY ISSUE.  NOT GOING TO ARGUE WITH THEM ANY MORE.... SOMETHING MUST BE DONE TO HELP US.   THE  RENTAL DTS I HAD WHILE MY CAR WAS IN "REPAIR" DID NOT HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM YET THEY SAID MY CAR TWILIGHT WAS "OK".  THANKS  *TR

2007 CADILLAC DTS VISION OBSCURED WHILE DRIVING. CONSUMER STATES THAT THE CENTER DOOR POST AND THE DRIVER SEAT HEAD REST ARE BLOCKING THE DRIVERS VIEW WHILE TURNING OR LOOKING BEHIND THE VEHICLE.  *KB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS.  THE CONTACT COULD NOT TURN THE STEERING WHEEL WHILE ATTEMPTING TO PULL INTO A PARKING SPACE AT 5 MPH.  HE WAS EVENTUALLY ABLE TO PARK THE VEHICLE AND IMMEDIATELY CALLED THE DEALER.  A MECHANIC ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AND FOUND THE SERPENTINE BELT LAYING ALONGSIDE THE ENGINE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER.  THE BOLTS THAT HOLD THE BRACKET AND PULLEY BROKE, AS A RESULT, THE VEHICLE COULD NOT BE DRIVEN.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 5,200.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC DTS.  WHILE DRIVING 40 MPH, THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT THE SUN VISOR WAS UNEVEN.  WHEN SHE REMOVED THE SUN VISOR FROM THE FRONT TO THE SIDE, IT BEGAN HANGING UNEVENLY.  THERE IS ALSO A 4.5 INCH GAP THAT CAUSES THE SUN TO HINDER HER VISION.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER AND THEY STATED THAT A REPAIR COULD NOT BE MADE BECAUSE THE VEHICLE WAS DESIGNED IN THAT FASHION.  THE VISOR HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 6,100 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 500.

TL*-  THE CONTACT STATED  FOOT WAS GETTING STUCK BETWEEN THE CONSOLE AND THE GAS PEDAL.  THE CONTACT BELIEVED THAT  FOOT WAS GETTING STUCK BECAUSE OF THE PADDING ON THE CONSOLE, BY THE GAS PEDAL. *AK  UPDATED 2/6/2007 -*NM
